article.headline: Holy Cross 61, Hofstra 47
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Pat Doherty scored 18 points and Holy Cross outscored Hofstra 17-3 during a nearly nine-minute stretch at the end of the first half and start of the second for a 61-47 win on Saturday might. Alex Vander Baan added 10 points with 15 rebounds for Holy Cross (1-0). Antoine Aguido scored 28 points for Hofstra (0-1). There were two ties and six lead changes in the first half, with Aguido scoring a layup to give the Pride a 19-18 lead with 6:56 remaining inthe first half. Vander Baan scored on a layup at the 5:24 mark for a 20-19 lead, and the Crusaders began to steadily pull away. Holy Cross outscored the Pride 13-5 to the end of the half. Holy Cross pulled ahead 38-24 with 17:54 left in the game. The Pride's Dane Johnson converted a free throw, but Colin Cunningham scored two free throws and Vander Baan and Doherty added field goals to give the Crusaders a 44-27 lead with 12:48 left. Aguido, who was 6-13 in three-pointers, led the Pride on an 13-8 run to pull within 45-35. Darren Townes then made a steal and dunked to make it 52-42 with 4:03 remaining. Kyle Cruze answered with a 3-point field goal to ignite a 12-2 over the next 3:40 to clinch the contest.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
